column1: NEW CLASS SPREAD SHEET WITH CROSSVERSION MATCHING
If you find errors on this sheet, plz put what it should be in the comments column. Don't edit the cell directly. Thx !

column6: These are biomes not mob spawners (has info on the type of mobs to see in the biome though)
Base class and manager for block types
Base class for glass and ice (not used directly)
Base class for block that can have content (not used directly)
Block used for wooden door and iron door
Block used for flowing water and lava
Base class for fluids (not used directly)
Base class for leaves (not used directly). It seems to be separated out possibly as a base class for objects that change textures based on graphics settings (fancy/fast).
Block used for gold, iron, diamond and coal
Block used for gold, diamond and iron blocks
Block used for standing signs and wall signs
Block used for stationary water and lava
Block used for half step and double step
Canvas used for drawing the isometric preview
Reader for the font.txt file which defines legal characters for chat
Chunk of blocks in the world (16x16x128 blocks)
Caches a bunch of chunks of the world
Pair of integers used as index of chunk (x,z).
Chunk provider which loads chunks from the server
Chunk provider which generates new chunks (used by other chunk providers)
Chunk provider which either loads chunks or generates them with ChunkProviderGenerate
Chunk provider which manages chunks on the server for all clients
Provides function to read and write gzipped streams, also used to compress NBT compounds
General callbacks for overlay crafting. onGUI_Closed and on_CraftMatrixChanged.
Callbacks for the player inventory. (As a side note, methods here are made for a 9 slots matrix, not 4, must be a left over from a previous version before the workbenches)
Callbacks for the workbench. Drop items on the ground when closed, check for recipies when changed.
Base class and manager for entities (everything that moves freely, like mobs, players, animals, ...)
Player entity for multiplayer mode (the player who is actually playing on that client)
Base class for creatures (animals and mobs)
Effect for digging and breaking blocks
Item (used for almost anything that can be dropped and collected)
Base class for living beings (animals, mobs, players)
Player entity for multiplayer mode (other players who are on the same server)
Base class for player entity types
Player entity for multiplayer mode (server class for all players)
Player entity for single player mode
Effect for raindrops on the ground
Effect for smoke and large smoke
enum with everything, mobs and player
Used to allocate gl lists and textures
Base class for all gui screens and overlays
All gui screen for containers like inventory, chest, ...
All overlays of the game while playing
Base class for all gui screens
Slider like the ones for volume in options
Interface with methods to access (read) single blocks in the world or in caches
Interface for all kinds of inventories
Used in iso-listener and has imagebuffer references
Base class and manager for item types
Item type used for all kinds of armor
Used for all food items and as a base for soup
Deals with inventory item stacks, spawns new stacks etc.
A linked list element for the hash table
Defines material properties for object, like if it can burn, ...
Material for objects with some kind of logik (growers, redstone circuits, ...)
stores if blocks in a chunk are solid (ground) or air
Implementation of the abstract class Minecraft
Looks like its actually a RayTraceHit
Base class for network communication handling
Used to store a nibble (4bit) array of data for things like light maps and chunk data.
Don't have proper name for it yet
Uses NoiseGenerator2 instead of old Perlin noise generator
Check OpenGL capabilities (only checks for occlusion query so far)
Base class and manager for network packets
Maintains a sorted set of path points
Result of the pathfinder processing; used to make an Entity follow a path
A point on a path used for pathfinding
An instance of a connected player
Manages a list of all connected players
Logic for minecart tracks (looks like it was inner class to minecarttrack)
Used by renderers to switch renderstates and also contains some other tool functions
All render classes are assigned to entity types here
Used to sort rendering list from the position of the player relative to the object (front-to-back or back-to-front rendering?)
Holds the server command and a reference to the command handler
Inventory slot used for the 4 equip slots for armor.
Inventory slot containing the crafting result.
Used to spawn creatures near to players. There are two instances, one which spawns animals and one (of the subclass) that spawns monsters.
Sound type when walking on a block type
Base class for texture effects (lava, flames, compass, ...)
Verify username/password at the minecraft.net website
Main thread of the server application
Implement gh (inventory classe). Class inheritance is stronger than interface implementations for the naming scheme.
Implement gh (inventory classe). Class inheritance is stronger than interface implementations for the naming scheme.
Used to profile the game for performance stats
A Vector consisting of 3 doubles, with helper functions. Name Vec to avoid clash with java.lang.Vector
Manager class for the world (only used directly on the client for singleplayer)
World on the client for multiplayer
Generates dirt, gravel, coal ore, iron ore, gold ore, redstone ore and diamond ore in underground
